result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor I Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in count 2, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

supervisions.notes: The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of probation as imposed in count 1 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
With credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant to report by 4pm on 10-30-2015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victor I Lopez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Victor I Lopez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
As to count 1:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in count 2, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
As to count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant to report by 4pm on 10-30-2015.
The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges as a condition of probation as imposed in count 1 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Sentencing Referral Form.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Victor I Lopez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the REPEATER enhancer as to counts 1 and 2 will be deleted with pleas to each count:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Count 3 is ordered dismissed nd read in for sentencing.  Sentencing is adjourned to 10-27-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Victor I Lopez in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 10-13-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-28-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

15RM035777  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/30/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marialina J. or her children.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Victor I Lopez in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Victor I Lopez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
